newsitem.title: USA: Sparton sees profit from operations.
newsitem.headline: Sparton sees profit from operations.

text.p: Sparton Corp, which posted a loss from continuing operations for the first quarter ended September 30, expects profitable operations from its continuing operations for the balance of the fiscal year.

"While the quarter was not profitable, the month of September was and we expect profitable operations from our continuing operations for the balance of this fiscal year," said chairman John Smith in a statement.

For the quarter, the company had an operating loss of $0.03 per share compared with a year-ago operating loss of $0.19. Results excluded losses from continuing operations of $0.02 versus $0.15 a year ago.
Sparton, which makes electronic systems, expects to close on December 5 the sale to Dura Automotive Systems Inc of its KPI business unit for $80.5 million.
It said proceeds will be used to retire all existing debt and applied to further development of Sparton's electronic contract manufacturing business.
